supported_integrations.description: Use AWS S3 for storing and retrieving large datasets for Atlas.
setup_steps: Upload your dataset to an S3 bucket.
Generate a pre-signed URL for the file.
Use the pre-signed URL to upload data to Atlas via the API.

example_code.python:
import boto3
import requests

# Step 1: Generate a pre-signed URL for your S3 file
s3 = boto3.client('s3')
response = s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object',
                                     Params={'Bucket': '<bucket_name>', 'Key': '<file_key>'},
                                     ExpiresIn=3600)

# Step 2: Use the pre-signed URL to upload data to Atlas
atlas_url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/data/upload'
headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer <API_KEY>', 'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
data = {'file_url': response}
response = requests.post(atlas_url, headers=headers, json=data)
print(response.json())

aws_s3_integration.description: Use AWS S3 to manage large datasets for Atlas integration.
aws_s3_integration.code:
import boto3
import requests

# Step 1: Upload data to S3
s3 = boto3.client('s3')
bucket_name = '<bucket_name>'
file_name = '<file_name>'
s3.upload_file(file_name, bucket_name, file_name)

# Step 2: Generate a pre-signed URL
response = s3.generate_presigned_url('get_object',
                                     Params={'Bucket': bucket_name, 'Key': file_name},
                                     ExpiresIn=3600)

# Step 3: Upload the data to Atlas
atlas_url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/data/upload'
headers = {'Authorization': 'Bearer <API_KEY>', 'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
data = {'file_url': response}
response = requests.post(atlas_url, headers=headers, json=data)
print(response.json())

notes: Ensure you have the necessary permissions and API keys for both Nomic Atlas and the third-party tool.
For cloud storage integrations, verify that files are accessible via pre-signed URLs or shareable links.
Refer to the documentation of the third-party tool for specific integration details or troubleshooting.
